A Meeting in the Tavern

A dim tavern, Raskolnikov and a clerk eye each other.  
A sense of unease lingers.  
Raskolnikov: "Why is he staring at me?"  

Clerk: "You look troubled, young man."  
Raskolnikov: "It's nothing... just tired."  

Clerk: "Weary of the world, I see."  
Raskolnikov: "You donâ€™t know me."  

---  

The clerk leans closer, intrigued.  
A flicker of madness in his eyes.  
Clerk: "But I want to know."  

Raskolnikov: "Some things are better left alone."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is intrigued by a peculiar retired clerk in a tavern, who exudes a mix of intelligence and madness despite his disheveled appearance.
